alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 1:30PM MST until August 07 at 4:30PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected around the Sierra Vista area. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, Cochise. * WHEN...Until 430 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 130 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Babocomari River and San Pedro River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sierra Vista and Fort Huachuca. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
